BR_text.BRdescription:
Hi,
 In the notebook, the parser to load the Potsdam data must be modified :
 Original :   all_ids = ["".join(f.split('')[3:5]) for f in all_files]
 What works : all_ids =  ["".join(f.split('')[5:7]) for f in all_files]
 And there is a typo in DATA_FOLDER for Potsdam :  it begins with a "3" not with a "Y".

comments_0.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gaslen>@gaslen</denchmark-link>
  <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nshaud>@nshaud</denchmark-link>
 
 Why should it be 3_Ortho_IRRG , not 2_Ortho_RGB ?  I think we use use 2 instead of Y. Do you think so ?

comments_1.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/hurricane2018>@hurricane2018</denchmark-link>
  You can use either 3_Ortho_IRRG if you want to use the IRRG data or 2_Ortho_RGB if you want to use RGB. Either are valid choices.
 The notebook has been updated to reflect this.
